comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Sergei Pavlovich Diaghilev (/diˈæɡɨlɛf/; Russian: Серге́й Па́влович Дя́гилев, Sergei Pavlovich Dyagilev, pronounced [sʲɪˈrɡʲej ˈpavləvʲɪtɕ ˈdʲæɡʲɪlʲɪf]; 31 March [O.S. 19 March] 1872 – 19 August 1929), usually referred to outside of Russia as Serge, was a Russian art critic, patron, ballet impresario and founder of the Ballets Russes, from which many famous dancers and choreographers would arise." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergei_Diaghilev This photo shows him on the French liner Lafayette, which arrived on January 11, 1916 in New York, see New-York tribune., January 12, 1916, Page 9. John Brown was the Business Comptroller/Controller of the Metropolitan Opera in New York, see comment by artolog under

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the information and links! We can add to the description when we next update it.
